channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Recent Afghan Arrivals Fear Their Futures in the U.S. Are Now in Jeopardy
item.description: Many are anxious after the Trump administration vowed to undertake sweeping reviews of immigrants after the shooting of two National Guard troops.

item.title: The Uniquely American Heartbreak of Yet Another Tragedy
item.description: The National Guard members shot in Washington are the latest victims of a political violence permeating our society.

item.title: D.C. Shooting Suspect Worked With C.I.A.-Backed Unit in Afghanistan
item.description: The C.I.A. and an Afghan intelligence official said that the shooter had been part of an Afghan “partner force,” known as a Zero Unit, trained and sup...

item.title: Trump’s Greedy Thanksgiving
item.description: This year, it’s not about giving back; it’s about getting yours.

item.title: Carney Lifts Climate Laws for New Alberta Pipeline
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney reached a tentative deal with the province as part of his program to curb the country’s economic dependence on the United S...

item.title: Carney Lifts Climate Laws for New Alberta Pipeline
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney reached a tentative deal with the province as part of his program to curb the country’s economic dependence on the United S...

item.title: Mark Carney says Canada’s trading relationship with the U.S. was ‘once a strength,’ but ‘now a weakness’
item.description: Canada struck a pipeline deal with Alberta on Thursday to diversify the country's oil exports beyond the U.S.

item.title: JPMorgan to build new London headquarters in Canary Wharf
item.description: "This building will represent our lasting commitment to the city, the UK" and its staff, said JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon.

item.title: The world’s top designers are exploring whether the private sector can move the needle on the UN’s SDGs
item.description: “Every time you design something, you're making an active choice on the future you want to build,” says Ben Sheppard, founder of Design for Good.

item.title: Sorry, mom. The shopping bots suggested a bathrobe for Christmas
item.description: Bloomberg asked several AI bots — including Amazon’s Rufus, OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Walmart Inc.’s Sparky — what to buy mom for Christmas.

item.title: Trump orders new immigration curbs as FBI probes guard shooting
item.description: Authorities have launched a nationwide terrorism investigation into what Jeanine Pirro, the US attorney for DC, called a “brazen and targeted” attack.

item.title: Images From the Deadly High-Rise Fire in Hong Kong
item.description: The blaze tore through an apartment complex, killing scores. Dozens more are believed to be missing in what remains of the buildings.

item.title: At Least 55 Dead in Hong Kong Apartment Fire
item.description: Firefighters were still trying to fully extinguish the blaze more than 24 hours after it engulfed several towers in the complex. Dozens of people were...

item.title: Hong Kong’s Worst Fire in Decades Fuels Scrutiny of Safety Lapses
item.description: The authorities said flammable netting and foam boards may have fueled the city’s deadliest blaze in nearly 70 years, killing more than 90 and prompti...
